0: A Mexican congressman apparently climbed a 30-foot fence along the US border to send President Trump a message: Physical barriers are useless for stopping immigrants. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "I was able to scale it, climb it, and sit myself right here," Braulio Guerra, a congressman from the state of Quer√©taro, said in a video. "It would be simple for me to jump into the United States, which shows that it is unnecessary and totally absurd to build a wall." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR President Donald Trump's promise to build a wall along the US-Mexico border has been a hot topic in Mexico's political circles, where legislators and politicians have almost uniformly responded critically to the proposal. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The Trump administration, however, is already moving ahead with its plans, and is expected to solicit proposals in the coming weeks for "the design and build of several prototype wall structures in the vicinity of the United States border with Mexico." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Tump has said a solid wall would likely cost $12 billion, but Reuters has reported that the actual cost could be up to $21 billion. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Before perching himself atop the US border fence along Tijuana's beach, Guerra spoke with immigration
